alert.note: Alert for Giles; Maury (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 4:33PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Marshall, southeastern Maury, Giles and southern Bedford Counties through 515 PM CST... At 432 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Mount Pleasant to 10 miles east of Lexington. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shelbyville, Lewisburg, Pulaski, Ardmore, Cornersville, Wartrace, Elkton, Minor Hill, Lynnville, Culleoka, Belfast, Goodspring, Frankewing, Prospect and Farmington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for Middle Tennessee.
